abstract: First screened on the Ten Network, Part Three of this four part mini-series focusing on the Goddard family during the Vietnam War years 1964-1972.
description: "Featuring an award-winning performance from a young Nicole Kidman. An epic story of Australia's involvement in the Vietnam war as told by the Goddard family whose son Phillip (Nicholas Eadie), is conscripted to fight in the war and whose father, Douglas (Barry Otto), is one of the key Canberra bureaucrats responsible for the policy of Australia's involvement in the war. Tracing their personal lives and career paths during the dramas thrown up by the war in Vietnam, this classic mini-series tells the epic story of Australia's involvement in the Vietnam War through the history of a middle class family the Goddards." Source: The Australian Film and Television Companion.  In part three of this epic mini-series, Phillip returns to Vietnam hoping to reunite with Lien. However, Viet Cong infiltration of the village propels them in opposite directions. The looming collapse of Evelyn and Douglas' marriage drives Megan to Sydney and independence.
